results.title: The Wisdom of crocodiles = Immortality
results.creator_credit: Zenith Productions, David Lascelles, Carolyn Choa and Po Chih Leong
results.brief_description: The Wisdom of crocodiles, directed by Hong Kong veteran director Po Chih Leong, is an elegant thriller set in contemporary London that combines the serial killer and vampire genres. Steven Grlscz is a charming, wealthy man who lures beautiful women and then subjects them to wicked, deathly pursuits. A sprucely variant of the Dracula myth, “The Wisdom of crocodiles” creates its central character, Grlscz, as a complex individual who lives alone in a gothic, decadent, highly ornamental London ‘pad’ and spends his spare time cataloguing the death of his victims. Grlscz’s killer instinct derives from the Dracula myth tradition: he kills in order to sustain his own well-being and life force. Though evidence points to Grlscz as a suspect, his brilliance outsmarts the police; in fact, Inspector Healey, the Catholic police inspector who tails Grlscz, comes to like and respect him after Grlscz saves his life. Soon enough, they develop a friendship and ruminate on philosophic matters of good and evil, black and white, marriage and fidelity, and so on. Steven’s killer instinct is challenged when he meets structural engineer, Anna Levels, whose combination of femininity and worldliness, sensuality and astuteness, vulnerability and independence, ultimately saves her life. Director Po Chih Leong and writer Paul Hoffman have created a sophisticated, engaging thriller that fits complex characters with gorgeous visuals and an inventive soundtrack. Cast includes Jude Law, Elina Lowensohn, Timothy Spall and Kerry Fox.

results.title: The Winning breed
results.brief_description: The film looks at the breeding of thoroughbred racehorses. Important factors in breeding are discussed and the film surveys some of the activities and a variety of horses which are found in several Australian stud farms owned by Wright Stevensons.

results.title: The Wings of the dove
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Renaissance Dove, Stephen Evans, David Parfitt and Iain Softley
results.brief_description: When Kate (Helena Bonham-Carter) falls in love with middle class journalist Martin (Linus Roache), her benefactor Aunt refuses to accept their union, believing her niece can do better. She offers Kate an ultimatum, stay with her lover and renounce any financial support for herself and her father, or assume her rightful place in society and promise to never see him again. Months later, an American heiress, Millie (Alison Elliot), enters their milieu and Kate forms a friendship with the new visitor. When Kate discovers that Millie is not only rich, but dying, her mind toys with the possibility of finding a way that she and Martin can be together and financially successful- Martin must fall in love with Millie. Set in Venice in the early 1900’s, this lavish period drama is based on the novel by Henry James. Cast includes Elizabeth McGovern, Charlotte Rampling and Michael Gambon.

results.title: The Wings of eagles
results.creator_credit: Charles Schnee, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and John Ford
results.brief_description: The story is based on the life of Spig Wead, a pioneer aviator, renowned screenwriter. He scripted two of Ford’s films and was a personal friend. Spig is unable to combine his career and marriage. The exuberance of the early scenes of inter-service rivalry and the pursuit of glory rings hollow in what is basically an unattractive portrait of military life. Following the breakdown of his marriage and a crippling accident, Wead is overtaken by a profound sense of failure and loss. Cast includes John Wayne, Dan Dailey, Maureen O’Hara, Ward Bond.

results.title: The Winger with Gordon Hill
results.creator_credit: Ray Marshall, Terry Ryan and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
Gordon Hill, Derby’s left-winger, shows that speed, accurate crossing and dribbling are vitally important to the winger’s game.

results.title: The Winged scourge
results.brief_description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.
results.description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.

results.title: The Winged go-betweens
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio and Miu Chin
results.brief_description: A nature film on the life of bees, concentrating in particular on their most useful function - the pollination of flowers. Using close-ups the camera reveals the work and behaviour of these insects in a way rarely seen before on the screen. A fascinating insight into their world.

results.title: The Windwheel
results.brief_description: The windwheel is a short animated story of a girl and her father at a fun park. It was drawn entirely under the camera by Susan Stamp using charcoal as the primary drawing medium. The story follows the father and his daughter as they share the sights, sounds and rides of the fun park. When she is given a small windwheel, the girl is delighted and plays happily until her father is accidentally knocked in the eye by it.

results.title: The Winds of Jarrah
results.creator_credit: Film Corporation of Western Australia, Mark Egerton and Marj Pearson
results.brief_description: Based on a Harlequin/Mills and Boon novel “The house in the timberwoods” by Joyce Dingwell. Set in Australia in 1946, it is the story of an English governess employed by the wealthy boss of a timber empire. He and his three children harbour a deep mistrust of women and she is befriended by one of the many returned servicemen in the timberlands. Stars Terence Donovan and Susan Lyons, supported by Harold Hopkins, Steve Bisley and Martin Vaughan.

results.title: The Winds of Fogo
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Fogo is a windswept island off the coast of Newfoundland where the inhabitants have lived by, on and from the sea. A fisherman and his sons take a day off from the nets for a journey to the gannet colony on the Funk Islands, fifty miles farther out to sea. There are exceptional close-up views of enormous flocks of seabirds swarming the cliffs and the sky.
